com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.bootstrapui.util

Class SortableTableBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.views.bootstrapui.util.SortableTableBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.ViewElementBuilder<com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.elements.ContainerViewElement>

    @Component
 @Scope(value="prototype")
public class SortableTableBuilder
extends Object
implements com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.ViewElementBuilder<com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.elements.ContainerViewElement>
    Helper that aids in building a sortable TableViewElement for a list of EntityPropertyDescriptors.
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SortableTableBuilder.OrderPair
      Simple class for JSON serializing sortable properties.
      static class  SortableTableBuilder.ResultNumberProcessor
      Sets the position of the item being processed (in an IteratorViewElementBuilderContext) as the text of a TextViewElement.

        public SortableTableBuilder entityType(String entityType)

      • noResults

        public SortableTableBuilder noResults(com.foreach.across.modules.web.ui.ViewElementBuilder builder)
        Set a custom no results view element to be returned if the data page is empty. If not set a default panel with text will be created.
        Parameters:
        builder - to be shown in case the page is empty

        public SortableTableBuilder tableName(String tableName)
        Set the table name that will be added as data-attribute on the table element, and will be the internal name of the main container ViewElement.
        Parameters:

      • formName

        public SortableTableBuilder formName(String formName)
        Optionally set the form name that this sortable table is bound to. When changing page the form will be updated and submitted instead of the url of the page itself.
        Parameters:
        formName - name of the form element

        public SortableTableBuilder propertyRegistry(EntityPropertyRegistry entityPropertyRegistry)
        Configure the EntityPropertyRegistry that should be used for fetching the property descriptors. If none specified, the registry from the EntityConfiguration will be used. If EntityPropertyDescriptors are added directly, the registry will never be used.
        Parameters:
        entityPropertyRegistry - instance
        Returns:
        current builder

      • properties

        public SortableTableBuilder properties(Collection<EntityPropertyDescriptor> propertyDescriptors)
        Explicitly specify the collection of EntityPropertyDescriptor instances that should be rendered. This will take precedence over any selector specified and does not require you to have a valid EntityPropertyRegistry.
        Parameters:
        propertyDescriptors - to use
        Returns:
        current builder

      • sortableOn

        public SortableTableBuilder sortableOn(String... sortableProperties)
        Limit the properties that can be sorted on by specifiying them explicitly. If the collection is null then all properties that have a Sort.Order attribute will be sortable.
        Parameters:
        sortableProperties - collection of property names that can be sorted on
